greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: If n is k-th number with an odd number of prime divisors (counted with multiplicity) [i.e., n = A026424(k)], a(n) = 2*k, otherwise, when n is k-th number with an even number of prime divisors [i.e., n = A028260(k)], a(n) = (2*k)-1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: For all n >= 1, A000035(a(n)) = 1 - A066829(n). [Permutation A245603 has the same property].
maple: N:= 1000: # to get a(1) to a(N)
for k from 1 to nops(Odds) do A[Odds[k]]:= 2*k od:
for k from 1 to nops(Evens) do A[Evens[k]]:= 2*k-1 od:
mathematica: Array[a, m] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 09 2019, from Maple *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 29 2008
